citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC investigation documented one occurrence of off-protocol activities involving nonhuman primates (NHPs): five
(5) vervets received anesthesia and MRI procedures not approved on their protocol. This occurred in Jan. 2024. No
known negative effects were documented following the anesthesia and MRI procedures.
Performing activities not covered by IACUC-approved protocols can result in harm or death to the impacted animals. The
regulations state that with respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall
review and approve, require modifications in (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes
regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities.
Corrective actions included re-training of staff.

In Jan. 2024, there was a juvenile vervet suspended by her collar on a section of damaged chain link that supported a
barrel device (enrichment device) in the enclosure. Despite prompt veterinary intervention, the animal died due to the
entrapment of the collar on the damaged chain.
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the nonhuman primates from injury.
Corrected prior to inspection.
Corrective actions included setting up a new process for maintenance of enrichment devices and discontinuing the
previously used type of chain.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
MARY ANN MCBRIDE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
